channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Low-code LLM: Visual Programming over LLMs
item.description: The proposed Low-code LLM framework consists of a Planning LLM that designs a structured planning workflow for complex tasks, which can be correspondingly edited and confirmed by users through low-code visual programming operations, and an Executing LLM that generates responses following the user-confirmed workflow.

item.title: Conditional Generation of Audio from Video via Foley Analogies
item.description: Second, we propose a model for generating a soundtrack for a silent input video, given a user-supplied example that specifies what the video should "sound like".

item.title: VALOR: Vision-Audio-Language Omni-Perception Pretraining Model and Dataset
item.description: Different from widely-studied vision-language pretraining models, VALOR jointly models relationships of vision, audio and language in an end-to-end manner.

item.title: Uncovering the Background-Induced bias in RGB based 6-DoF Object Pose Estimation
item.description: We analyze how the presence of the markers affects the pose estimation accuracy, and how this bias may be mitigated through data augmentation and other methods.

item.title: An Empirical Study of Multitask Learning to Improve Open Domain Dialogue Systems
item.description: Autoregressive models used to generate responses in open-domain dialogue systems often struggle to take long-term context into account and to maintain consistency over a dialogue.

item.title: From Zero to Hero: Examining the Power of Symbolic Tasks in Instruction Tuning
item.description: Empirical results on various benchmarks validate that the integration of SQL execution leads to significant improvements in zero-shot scenarios, particularly in table reasoning.

item.title: Tool Learning with Foundation Models
item.description: Considering the lack of a systematic tool learning evaluation in prior works, we experiment with 17 representative tools and show the potential of current foundation models in skillfully utilizing tools.

item.title: MELT: Mutual Enhancement of Long-Tailed User and Item for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: The long-tailed problem is a long-standing challenge in Sequential Recommender Systems (SRS) in which the problem exists in terms of both users and items.

item.title: MMANet: Margin-aware Distillation and Modality-aware Regularization for Incomplete Multimodal Learning
item.description: It consists of three components: the deployment network used for inference, the teacher network transferring comprehensive multimodal information to the deployment network, and the regularization network guiding the deployment network to balance weak modality combinations.

item.title: Normalizing Flow-based Neural Process for Few-Shot Knowledge Graph Completion
item.description: In this paper, we propose a normalizing flow-based neural process for few-shot knowledge graph completion (NP-FKGC).

item.title: Chinese Open Instruction Generalist: A Preliminary Release
item.description: Instruction tuning is widely recognized as a key technique for building generalist language models, which comes to the attention of researchers and the public with the release of InstructGPT \cite{ouyang2022training} and ChatGPT [ https://chat. openai. com/ ].

item.title: Energy Efficiency Considerations for Popular AI Benchmarks
item.description: Advances in artificial intelligence need to become more resource-aware and sustainable.

item.title: InstructUIE: Multi-task Instruction Tuning for Unified Information Extraction
item.description: Large language models have unlocked strong multi-task capabilities from reading instructive prompts.

item.title: RadarFormer: Lightweight and Accurate Real-Time Radar Object Detection Model
item.description: This improvement was associated with the increasing use of LiDAR sensors and point cloud data to facilitate the task of object detection and recognition in autonomous driving.

item.title: LongForm: Optimizing Instruction Tuning for Long Text Generation with Corpus Extraction
item.description: Our models outperform 10x larger language models without instruction tuning on various tasks such as story/recipe generation and long-form question answering.

item.title: DisCo-CLIP: A Distributed Contrastive Loss for Memory Efficient CLIP Training
item.description: In this way, we can reduce the GPU memory consumption of contrastive loss computation from $\bigO(B^2)$ to $\bigO(\frac{B^2}{N})$, where $B$ and $N$ are the batch size and the number of GPUs used for training.

item.title: Prak: An automatic phonetic alignment tool for Czech
item.description: Labeling speech down to the identity and time boundaries of phones is a labor-intensive part of phonetic research.

item.title: Political corpus creation through automatic speech recognition on EU debates
item.description: We release the resulting corpus and our analysis pipeline for future research.

item.title: Everyone Can Be Picasso? A Computational Framework into the Myth of Human versus AI Painting
item.description: The recent advances of AI technology, particularly in AI-Generated Content (AIGC), have enabled everyone to easily generate beautiful paintings with simple text description.

item.title: A Comparative Study between Full-Parameter and LoRA-based Fine-Tuning on Chinese Instruction Data for Instruction Following Large Language Model
item.description: In this study, we undertook experimental comparisons between full-parameter fine-tuning and LoRA-based tuning methods, utilizing LLaMA as the base model.

item.title: Attention Mixtures for Time-Aware Sequential Recommendation
item.description: Transformers emerged as powerful methods for sequential recommendation.

item.title: Prediction-Oriented Bayesian Active Learning
item.description: Information-theoretic approaches to active learning have traditionally focused on maximising the information gathered about the model parameters, most commonly by optimising the BALD score.

item.title: Collaborative Residual Metric Learning
item.description: In collaborative filtering, distance metric learning has been applied to matrix factorization techniques with promising results.

item.title: DETRs Beat YOLOs on Real-time Object Detection
item.description: In this paper, we first analyze the influence of NMS in modern real-time object detectors on inference speed, and establish an end-to-end speed benchmark.

item.title: Interactive and Explainable Region-guided Radiology Report Generation
item.description: While previous methods generate reports without the possibility of human intervention and with limited explainability, our method opens up novel clinical use cases through additional interactive capabilities and introduces a high degree of transparency and explainability.

item.title: Refusion: Enabling Large-Size Realistic Image Restoration with Latent-Space Diffusion Models
item.description: This work aims to improve the applicability of diffusion models in realistic image restoration.

item.title: Delving into Shape-aware Zero-shot Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Thanks to the impressive progress of large-scale vision-language pretraining, recent recognition models can classify arbitrary objects in a zero-shot and open-set manner, with a surprisingly high accuracy.

item.title: BenchMD: A Benchmark for Modality-Agnostic Learning on Medical Images and Sensors
item.description: Finally, we evaluate performance on out-of-distribution data collected at different hospitals than the training data, representing naturally-occurring distribution shifts that frequently degrade the performance of medical AI models.

item.title: STRAP: Structured Object Affordance Segmentation with Point Supervision
item.description: By label affinity, we refer to affordance segmentation as a multi-label prediction problem: A plate can be both holdable and containable.

item.title: DeepSim-Nets: Deep Similarity Networks for Stereo Image Matching
item.description: Our features are learnt on large image tiles to be expressive and capture the scene's wider context.

item.title: One-shot and Partially-Supervised Cell Image Segmentation Using Small Visual Prompt
item.description: Semantic segmentation of microscopic cell images using deep learning is an important technique, however, it requires a large number of images and ground truth labels for training.

item.title: Learning to "Segment Anything" in Thermal Infrared Images through Knowledge Distillation with a Large Scale Dataset SATIR
item.description: We discovered that this ability of SAM can be leveraged to pretrain models for specific fields.

item.title: Decentralized Learning Made Easy with DecentralizePy
item.description: Decentralized learning (DL) has gained prominence for its potential benefits in terms of scalability, privacy, and fault tolerance.

item.title: MoDA: Modeling Deformable 3D Objects from Casual Videos
item.description: To solve this problem, we propose neural dual quaternion blend skinning (NeuDBS) to achieve 3D point deformation, which can perform rigid transformation without skin-collapsing artifacts.

item.title: SCANet: Self-Paced Semi-Curricular Attention Network for Non-Homogeneous Image Dehazing
item.description: The presence of non-homogeneous haze can cause scene blurring, color distortion, low contrast, and other degradations that obscure texture details.

item.title: Beyond first-order methods for non-convex non-concave min-max optimization
item.description: We propose a study of structured non-convex non-concave min-max problems which goes beyond standard first-order approaches.

item.title: Efficient and Effective Text Encoding for Chinese LLaMA and Alpaca
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs), such as ChatGPT and GPT-4, have revolutionized natural language processing research and demonstrated potential in Artificial General Intelligence (AGI).

item.title: TreeC: a method to generate interpretable energy management systems using a metaheuristic algorithm
item.description: This method learns the decision strategy of the EMS based on historical data contrary to RBC and MPC approaches that are typically considered as non adaptive solutions.

item.title: Open-World Weakly-Supervised Object Localization
item.description: To handle such data, we propose a novel paradigm of contrastive representation co-learning using both labeled and unlabeled data to generate a complete G-CAM (Generalized Class Activation Map) for object localization, without the requirement of bounding box annotation.

item.title: Recursive Joint Attention for Audio-Visual Fusion in Regression based Emotion Recognition
item.description: In video-based emotion recognition (ER), it is important to effectively leverage the complementary relationship among audio (A) and visual (V) modalities, while retaining the intra-modal characteristics of individual modalities.

item.title: Improving Weakly Supervised Temporal Action Localization by Bridging Train-Test Gap in Pseudo Labels
item.description: Besides, the generated pseudo-labels can be fluctuating and inaccurate at the early stage of training.

item.title: Text2Performer: Text-Driven Human Video Generation
item.description: In this work, we present Text2Performer to generate vivid human videos with articulated motions from texts.

item.title: MasaCtrl: Tuning-Free Mutual Self-Attention Control for Consistent Image Synthesis and Editing
item.description: Despite the success in large-scale text-to-image generation and text-conditioned image editing, existing methods still struggle to produce consistent generation and editing results.

item.title: PCPNet: An Efficient and Semantic-Enhanced Transformer Network for Point Cloud Prediction
item.description: In this letter, we propose a novel efficient Transformer-based network to predict the future LiDAR point clouds exploiting the past point cloud sequences.

item.title: Towards Better Evaluation of GNN Expressiveness with BREC Dataset
item.description: Research on the theoretical expressiveness of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) has developed rapidly, and many methods have been proposed to enhance the expressiveness.

item.title: GaitRef: Gait Recognition with Refined Sequential Skeletons
item.description: Two common modalities used for representing the walking sequence of a person are silhouettes and joint skeletons.

item.title: Regularized Complete Cycle Consistent GAN for Anomaly Detection
item.description: This study presents an adversarial method for anomaly detection in real-world applications, leveraging the power of generative adversarial neural networks (GANs) through cycle consistency in reconstruction error.

item.title: MLRegTest: A Benchmark for the Machine Learning of Regular Languages
item.description: Evaluating machine learning (ML) systems on their ability to learn known classifiers allows fine-grained examination of the patterns they can learn, which builds confidence when they are applied to the learning of unknown classifiers.

item.title: M2GNN: Metapath and Multi-interest Aggregated Graph Neural Network for Tag-based Cross-domain Recommendation
item.description: (2) From the CDR perspective, not all inter-domain interests are helpful to infer intra-domain interests.

item.title: Towards Better Instruction Following Language Models for Chinese: Investigating the Impact of Training Data and Evaluation
item.description: Recently, significant public efforts have been directed towards developing low-cost models with capabilities akin to ChatGPT, thereby fostering the growth of open-source conversational models.
